docs.lead_paragraph: International A3-12 CLINTON SEEKS EUROPEAN SUPPORT President Clinton pressured European allies to join in "tougher measures" against the Bosnian Serbs, which Senior officials said included arms shipments to the Muslims and air strikes to keep the Serbs at bay until the arms arrive. A1 BELGRADE TO CUT AID TO SERBS The Governments of Serbia and federal Yugoslavia said they would cut all but humanitarian aid to the Serbs in Bosnia and Herzegovina, saying they were angered by the Bosnian Serb parliament's rejection of a plan to end Bosnia's war. A1 WHAT EUROPEAN ALLIES WANTED News analysis: Firm leadership in the Balkans is what the European allies have wanted from President Clinton now that he has consulted them, despite their reluctance on U.S. military steps there. A1
